description: Tune Styler was a utility that allowed users to customize various aesthetic aspects of Windows, including the appearance of its login screen, boot screen, and startup logo. It was originally developed by TuneUp Corporation and included in that company's TuneUp Utilities program.

Eventually, TuneUp Corporation was acquired by AVG Technologies, which was itself acquired by Avast. At some point, AVG removed Tune Styler, which had been renamed AVG Styler, from TuneUp Utilities, which had been renamed AVG PC TuneUp Unlimited.
